Comment: Lol. FL-1 shifted 8% towards the Democrats and FL-6 shifted 10% towards the Democrats, and somehow you think this is disappointing? In an R+19 and an R+14 district?  **FL-1 (Cook PVI = R+19):**  2024: Gaetz (R)=66%; Valimont (D)=34%  2025: Patronis (R)=56.9%; Valimont (D) = 42.3%  **Fl-6 (Cook PVI = R+14):**  2024: Waltz (R) = 66.53%; Stockton (D) = 33.46%  2025: Fine (R)=56.7%; Well (D) = 42.7%  Oh, let's not forget this race:  **Wisconsin (Cook PVI = R+2):**  2024: Trump (R) = 49.60%, Harris (D) = 48.74%  2025: Crawford (Jurist) = 55.0%; Schimel (Muskovite) = 45.0%  A distinct shift away from the Republicans despite all the money Musk spent in WI.  Let's look at turnout:  **FL-1 (Cook PVI = R+19):**  2024: R=274.0K, D=140.9K  2025: R=97.3K, D=72.3K  **Fl-6 (Cook PVI = R+14):**  2024: R=284.4K, D=143.1K  2025: R=110.7K, D=83.5K  Turnout is expected to be lower for a special election. In this case, in both districts, Republican turnout dropped more than Democratic turnout.
